rem.description: Use as the base rem value for calculations in Figma Tokens. In production all size values should be in rems, which is modifiable by the user. Since Figma Tokens doesn't support different units, we use this variable to do rem calculations. For our purposes, we're setting the rem value to 16px.

description.value: In production, all fontSize units are in rems.
these are non-responsive font sizes used for body copy, helper text and other elements that don't need to respond to viewport width.

All of these fontSizes.figma tokens are used exclusively for convenience in Figma. We use them to generate the suite of styles we use in Figma and correspond to the screen size values in breakpoints. They are a representation of the dynamic sizes generated by the clamp functions in the fontSizes.dynamic object

These are the formulas that generate the responsive type sizes in production. Calculations like this aren't supported in Figma so we use the manually calculated fontSizes.figma tokens to generate a suite of styles that approximate the font size at our standard breakpoints.
In production, all units are in rems.
In production, all units are in rems.
These are our 3 drop shadow styles. All number values here are in px.

sans.description: Use as primary sans serif across applications

serif.description: Use as primary text serif in long-form reading applications

display.description: Use as primary brand display font

3.description: Use for small and medium sized headings.

5.description: Use for body-sized text in long-form reading applications.

description.value: In production, all units are in %.
In production, all units are in %.
In production, all units are in rems.
In production, units are in px for now. We will convert this to vw in the future.
In production, units are in px for now. We will convert this to vw in the future.
